question: Which among the following has highest velocity?
options: Hurricane
Tornado
Typhoon
Cyclone

question: In which of the following situations the force applied by the weight of a person becomes zero in a lift?
options: Lift moves up with an acceleration of 9.8 meter per sq. second
Lift moves down with an acceleration of 9.8 meter per sq. second
Lift moves up with an speed of 9.8 meter per second
Lift moves up with down speed of 9.8 meter per second
answer: Lift moves down with an acceleration of 9.8 meter per sq. second

question: If the distance between the earth and the sun becomes one-fourth of what it is now, the gravitational force exerted on the earth by the sun would be:
options: One-fourth of what it is now
One-sixteenth of what it is now
Sixteen times of what it is now
Four times of what it is now
answer: Sixteen times of what it is now

question: Two pieces of ice at 0°C would freeze together if pressed against each other and then released. In this context, which among the following is the correct principle in action in this?
options: The melting point of pure ice decreases with pressure.
The melting point of pure ice increases with Pressure
The melting point of pure ice first increases, then decreases with pressure
The melting point of pure ice first decreases then increases with pressure
answer: The melting point of pure ice decreases with pressure.

question: Due to which of the following phenomena, the coloured glass appears white when crushed into fine powder?
options: Total Internal Reflection
Diffraction
Scattering
Refraction

question: What is the value of Triple point of water?
What is the work done by centripetal force in case of Uniform Circular Motion?
options: 1 joule
0 joule
Depends on the magnitude of Force
None of the above

question: Which of the following is/are independent of mass during the projectile motion?
options: Time of Flight
Horizontal Range
Maximum Height
All of the above

question: The work done by a variable force is given by:
options: area under the force curve and the displacement axis
square of the area under the force curve and the displacement axis
natural log of the area under the force curve and the displacement axis
twice the area under the force curve and the displacement axis
answer: area under the force curve and the displacement axis

question: Which of the following is correct about the value of acceleration due to gravity?
options: it is greater at mountains than in plains
it is lesser at mountains than in plains
it is equal for mountains and plains
None of the above
answer: it is lesser at mountains than in plains
